entry.title: Include DIRECT fallback for IP Protection Proxy
entry.content:
The NSProxyAllowList creates the ProxyConfig used to set up the IP

Protection Proxy, and this should contain a fallback to DIRECT if the

proxy is not available. Doing so is simply a matter of appending

`,direct://` to the rules spec.



Also: minor cleanup in `network_service_proxy_allow_list*`, and update

the test in `network_service_proxy_delegate_unittest.cc` to show the

same effect.



Bug: 1471478

entry.title: Use RunUntilQuit in TranslationResultLoaderTest
entry.content:
With the introduction of the Rust JSON parser, the RunLoop becomes

"idle" while the parser runs in a threadapool, so RunUntilIdle returns

too soon. Better to use an explicit signal to quit.

entry.title: [@scope] Add WPT for name-defining at rules
entry.content:
Name-defining at-rules (e.g. @property) are allowed within @scope,

but they are not affected by the enclosing @scope. There is no

proximity that comes into play, nor are they "local" to the given

scope [1].



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-5/#scope-scope



Bug: 1450473

entry.title: [ios] Creates new EG matchers for context menu items.
entry.content:
iOS17 beta6 changed context menu accessibility labels to also include

the alt text for the menu item's icon. This broke all context menu

tests, as we were previously only matching the item's title.



This CL adds context menu matchers and implements them using a prefix

search, so that they continue to match the new a11y label. Existing

tests are updated to use these new context menu matchers where

appropriate.

entry.title: [@scope] Let CSSScopeRule::SetPreludeText preserve context
entry.content:
CSSScopeRule::SetPreludeText is an API that exists for devtools

purposes: it allows editing the @scope prelude. The problem is that

it does not provide the nesting type, parent rule,

and StyleSheetContents needed to create a StyleScope in its proper

context. For example, it's not possible to use SetPreludeText to create

an _implicit_ @scope rule, because we always pass nullptr as the

StyleSheetContents.



This CL fixes this issue by finding the relevant parent rule and

parent stylesheet during CSSScopeRule::SetPreludeText.



Fixed: 1457247

Change-Id: I4c22947ad230f7218cb4c367ebde1e6323b79d19

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4777910

Commit-Queue: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

entry.title: Revert "[Auto-disable Accessibility] Point ChromeAccessibilityUtil to AccessibilityState"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8d93191c13dfcc46850977db1dfce4fe2c5ca78c.



Reason for revert: tests on tablets failing with `java.lang.AssertionError: Unexpected call of recreate() in browser_test.` (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1473004)



Original change's description:

> [Auto-disable Accessibility] Point ChromeAccessibilityUtil to AccessibilityState

>

> This CL continues the work to consolidate all accessibility state

> management in Clank to a single source, AccessibilityState.java.

>

> With this CL we point the ChromeAccessibilityUtil to use

> AccessibilityState so that under-the-hood all parts of the Clank

> code-base are running off the same accessibility state engine.

> We do not remove the ChromeAccessibilityUtil to keep the code

> change small, and after some general usage and manual testing

> we will follow-up with a series of CLs to completely remove

> the ChromeAccessibilityUtil class.

>

> The implementation in AccessibilityState matches the previous

> existing impl of ChromeAccessibilityUtil, i.e. checking if

> accessibility is enabled is equivalent to asking: "is there a

> service that uses touch exploration enabled, OR, is there a

> service that requested to perform gestures enabled." This is

> subtly different than what AccessibilityState will consider as

> "enabled" in the future, since it provides more granularity in

> state information. As we move to AccessibilityState, we will

> audit usages and see if a more granular check can be applied on

> a case-by-case basis.

>

> AX-Relnotes: N/A

> Bug: 1430202, b/265493191

> Change-Id: I5757a4d2dc426a9c58107de4ca56ccf456d33968

entry.title: Cache management for IpProtectionAuthTokenCache
entry.content:
This CL adds "real" management of the auth token cache:

- Pre-fill the cache shortly after system startup, so that tokens are

ready to go when they are first needed.

- Fetch new tokens when the cache level falls below a low-water mark.

- Track token expiration and request new tokens as needed.



All of this is done in a power-efficient manner, only waking the

processor when necessary (such as when a token expires).



Bug: 1470340

Change-Id: I43ef767bcf8e0ada08c339fe45070d1361f83712

entry.title: Printing: Round *up* page sizes to nearest integer.
entry.content:
We used to round down, because that's what PrintRenderFrameHelper did,

but that's not the case any more, as of http://crrev.com/c/4767545 . The

problem with rounding down the page size, though, is that if an author

cannot assume that a box with the same size as the page size will

actually fit on one page.



Arguably, we shouldn't have to round at all, and just use sub-pixels,

but we're not quite there. For one, the paint code would cause pixel

bleed onto the next page. See new tests in external/wpt/css/printing/ .



Bug: 1444579

Change-Id: I49096a25724792ce05c3dd2209e56617f0533dae

entry.title: Set is_actively_scrolling bit during touch interactions
entry.content:
In crrev.com/c/4690922, we began plumbing a bit to optimize rendering

during an interaction, but in that CL it was limited to scrolling. It

turns out that this is too restrictive: just before a scroll begins,

there are touch events that can cause visual updates that can also be

delayed (and that we would like to optimize).



With this change, the is_actively_scrolling name becomes inaccurate.

I've logged crbug.com/1470329 to track cleaning this up.



credit: thanks to khushalsagar@ who had originally suggested this more

general approach on the bug and who also noticed that a compositor

frame not being presented quickly on touch start which precipitated

this CL.



Bug: 1082569

Change-Id: If48bfdecef5b3ff60a46668e152564be0621bb4a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4752394

entry.title: CCA: Make import side effect free
entry.content:
Currently models/barcode.ts and models/video_saver.ts initialize a

comlink on global scope, which would be run on import time. This is

problematic since video_saver is imported by cca_test.ts, which

currently has a race condition that it might be injected by tast side

before injectUntrustedJSModule in init.ts is run, causing the global

initialization to fail.



To fix this, we shouldn't do any side effect on module import time, so

the import timing won't matter.



CCAUIStress.fake_hal pass.

iterations=1000 camera.CCAUIStress.manual



Bug: b:296013012

Test: sleep(5000) after init.ts waitUntilReadyOnTastSide, and

Test: patch CCAUIStress.manual to use fake HAL, and tast run -var

entry.title: Revert "ARC testing: builder for ARC task windows"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ca5e651d043d79294ab887dadec4376203320848.



Reason for revert: causing MSAN build failure, see crbug/1472938



Original change's description:

> ARC testing: builder for ARC task windows

>

> This has come up in a few places so replace all of them with a single

> solution.

>

> Many tests allowed never specifying a shell root surface, and only two

> seemed to require it, in autotest_private_apitest.cc and

> arc_graphics_tracing_handler_unittest.cc (SwitchWindowDuringModelBuild).

>

> I prefer not creating a root surface automatically, as this can result

> in multiple root surfaces in the case that multiple windows are created,

> and the surface destruction also becomes implicit, both of which may be

> surprising. Another potential issue is that there will be fragmentation

> on style where some callers will prefer to explicitly make the surface

> (which only requires two very short additional lines) and some will use

> the implicit style.

>

> I ran into strange failures in the autotest_private_apitest.cc case

> until I explicitly removed focus from the ARC window. It also was not

> explicitly closing the window, so I used the OwnsNativeWidget style with

> autoptr rather than use a raw pointer. These two changes may have been

> interrelated.

>

> Test: auto_test.py -C ...

> Test: autoninja -C chrome chrome_sandbox nacl_helper

> Bug: 288895124

> Change-Id: I46fd9e57583e3e79eb02d47d408a093dec3b26c0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4770048

> Auto-Submit: Matthew DeVore

entry.title: TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest: Fix feature config
entry.content:
The configuration should use the string representation of the feature

parameters, not the int/enum representation. Else we get the following

error:

> Failed to parse field trial param memory_update_trigger with string

> value 0 under feature MemoryUsageInHovercards into an enum. Falling

> back to default value of 0



Note that the default value of 0 represents the `kBackground` parameter,

i.e. the tests were using the intended feature configuration even though

the parameter was incorrectly specified. Thus, this CL doesn't change

any behaviour apart from getting rid of the error message.



Bug: 1424226, 1424227

entry.title: More cross-platform pixel test support in MockPrinter.
entry.content:
It used to only work on Mac (maybe; no pixels were actually tested

due to no test coverage), and possibly Windows as well, using platform

code. It should now work in Linux, Mac and Windows, but not Android

(because PDF isn't enabled there).



Remove platform-specific code from printing::Image. Instead provide a

constructor that takes raw pixel data. Generate the raw pixel data

from PDF in MockPrinter.



MockPrinter::PrintPage() was confused (now named OnDocumentPrinted()).

It expected to be called once per page, but it is in fact only called

once per print job. Not that it really mattered, since no tests tested

more than one page. :-p



Enable PrintRenderFrameHelperTest.PrintWithIframe on all platforms that

support pixel testing.

Remove PrintRenderFrameHelperTest.PrintLayoutTest, since it's not very

useful. It was only enabled on Mac, and it essentially only tested if

the page size was *roughly* as expected. We can do better than this

now. Add PrintRenderFrameHelperTest.Pixels, which checks all the

pixels in a two-page printed document with mixed page size.



Change-Id: If275acb230b5834c0f843365d0ea9dfa26a70e78

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4765574

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1183555}

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Add VLOG for XDG toplevel states
entry.content:
Running with WAYLAND_DEBUG=1 doesn't log the actual values of

xdg_toplevel.configure's `states` parameter, only an opaque

representation like "array[16]". This makes it hard to debug issues

related to toplevel states like the linked bug. To help with debugging,

this CL adds a VLOG(1) that prints all xdg_toplevel states contained in

toplevel configure events (states specific to aura_shell are omitted for

brevity and can be added later if needed).



Bug: 1470678

entry.title: bindings: Support Web IDL async iterable (1 of 4)
entry.content:
Adds web_idl.AsyncIterator to web_idl_database.pickle.



AsyncIterator and AsyncIterable are very similar to SyncIterator

and Iterable/Maplike/Setlike.



The key differences between async iterable and iterable/maplike/

setlike (at this point) are:



1. Async iterable supports optional arguments.

async iterable(/* arguments... */);

which turns into:

obj.entries(/* arguments... */)

obj.keys(/* arguments... */)

obj.values(/* arguments... */)

while iterable doesn't support arguments.



2. Async iterator supports 'return' function optionally in

addition to the main 'next' function. Sync iterator has only

'next' function.

Disclaimer: This series of the patches doesn't support 'return'.

Will be supported later.



Bug: 1087157

Change-Id: I13d307ad450c9394a86d449b82f1d9828619790d

entry.title: [PA] PartitionPurgeSlotSpan() should use DecommitSystemPagesForData() for truncated slots if kUseLazyCommit is true.
entry.content:
LazyCommit depends on that both used slots and unused slots

(=in the freelist) are committed. However this removes the unused

slots from the freelist. So if using DiscardSystemPages() here,

PartitionAlloc may commit the system pages which has been already

committed again. This will make commited_size and max_committed_size

metrics wrong. PA should use DecommitSystemPagesForData() instead.



Bug: 1431606

entry.title: Delete DeprecateUnloadByUserAndOrigin.
entry.content:
Move params onto DeprecateUnload and default DeprecateUnloadPercent to

100. Before, to force a browser into deprecation you could do



DeprecateUnload=true

DeprecateUnloadByUserAndOrigin=false



(the 2nd one is required because will start to do the gradual rollout

via finch)



or



DeprecateUnload=true

DeprecateUnloadByUserAndOrigin=true

DeprecateUnloadPercent=100



Now you can just do DeprecateUnload=true because DeprecateUnloadPercent defaults to 100.



Avoiding deprecation still just requires DeprecateUnload=false.





Bug: 1472708

entry.title: [odfs] Add IN_USE error strings for Move and Delete IO task failures
entry.content:
A FILE_ERROR_IN_USE upon a Move/Delete failure in ODFS needs to be

conveyed to the user using a clear error string.



Previously:

- A generic error string was used for all Delete failures.

- "The file could not be modified." was shown for a FILE_ERROR_IN_USE

Move failure.

- The EventRouter had no mapping for the FILE_ERROR_IN_USE to the

error name. The default of "InvalidModificationError" was used.



Changes:

- Add a mapping for FILE_ERROR_IN_USE to "InUseError".

- Upon an "InUseError" of single-file events, show new strings for

Move/Delete failures.

- Applies to Delete failures: Only support single-file error events

as otherwise it is too confusing to try to explain the in-use

error.



Move before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8s4Dv7ahF4s2ciq.png

Move after: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BVKQSPzi2k5unp7



Delete before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BvF3XPjvqir84Qd.png

Delete after: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/77DLCe6exAJ3C4V.png



Bug: b/294293265

entry.title: Avoid break at empty line box beside block-in-inline.
entry.content:
There should not be a valid break opportunity at an empty line box. Such

line boxes may be created next to a line box with a block-in-inline

inside. We used to see a good (and even perfect) break opportunity

there, but it's better to pretend that such line boxes just don't exist,

as far as block fragmentation is concerned.



Also rename the has_processed_first_child_ state flag in

NGBlockLayoutAlgorithm. The name was already unfitting, and even more so

with this change.



Move the logic for determining whether a valid break opportunity exists

after a child (provided that another sibling is added), out of Layout()

and into code that has access to the new fragment added, since we now

need to look at the fragment size.



Bug: 1457464

Change-Id: Ie87a2578516b1a926975c31d360fc0801c0f2b71

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4628455

entry.title: [blink] Do not run pylint without Python files to check
entry.content:
The Blink pylint intended an empty (falsy) `files_to_check` to check

nothing, but the `GetPylint(...)` canned check [1] interpreted that as

check everything (`**/*.py`). Avoid the canned check entirely without

`files_to_check`.



[1]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/tools/depot_tools/+/main:presubmit_canned_checks.py;l=1110;drc=90fed308660fd53ac4247b7242f280b01731b1c7;bpv=0;bpt=0

entry.title: [LCPP] Fix DCHECK error on ResourcePrefetchPredictor::LearnLcpp
entry.content:
The following code caused "Check failed: 1 + SumOfFrequency(histogram,

other_bucket_frequency) <= kSlidingWindowSize (1000.000000 vs. 1000)"

failure. This CL adds `1e-5` to avoid floating point errors.



```

DCHECK_LE(1 + SumOfFrequency(histogram, other_bucket_frequency),

kSlidingWindowSize);

```

entry.title: [Share] Use cleaner intent to remove top ChooserActivity
entry.content:
The original CL cause a regression for CCT, as sending intent to itself creates a new CCT session. Based on the original CL, adding an intent extra so when activities receive the new intent, it'll be dropped properly.



Recording: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AZMhz-QWxQLuSZr8Tk-mFtGYK59aUzSL/view?usp=drive_link&resourcekey=0-ZffGjQClTpHLwlyLcp7mgw



(Description from original CL: crrev.com/c/4750566)



[Share] Remove TargetChosenReceiver when WindowAndroid destroyed



Android share sheet is showing with as ChooserActivity on top of Chrome. When theme switches, Chrome activity is recreated, so the previous stored custom actions should go away since they are referencing the old activity. As a result, the custom actions on the share sheet becomes no-op once selected.



This CL include the fix that:

* Remove the weak reference to Activity and WindowAndroid once it is removed from the UserDataHost (in WindowAndroid)

* Close the share sheet. This is done by sending an intent with Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TOP targeting to the dispatching activity.



Bug: 1470978, 1470036

Change-Id: I6c9efb35f1e77c92e78bfbe6a3d8220419319e5d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4763472

Commit-Queue: Wenyu Fu

entry.title: [SecureDLs] Don't warn on downloads that are downloaded from localhost
entry.content:
Insecure download warnings considered localhost secure, but would still

warn if they were initiated from an insecure page.



That's overly conservative -- a file hosted on your machine should be

considered secure. This CL adds that behavior. (As a nice bonus, when we

enable insecure download warnings by default, this'll cause fewer tests

to need updating.)



This CL also sneaks in a small test tweak to fix a test that would fail

when insecure download warnings are enabled since I was there anyway.



Bug: 1472461

Change-Id: I25907fa7b4940b8c90191d234ca884efc83fc116

entry.title: [App Service] Add optional port to intent filter authority condition
entry.content:
This CL updates the kAuthority (previously named kHost) intent filter

condition type to accept an optional port in its string value.

This condition accepts either a host by itself or host:port as a string

for backwards compatibility.



Callsites that add a kAuthority condition with a port must use

apps_utils::AuthorityView::Encode() to set the condition value.



This change updates web apps to only intent filter their specific

host:port combo rather than all ports on their host. This is in line

with the origin security model where different ports are considered

different isolated origins.



Bug: 1468870

entry.title: Make UseFileForFakeAudioCapture work in more places.
entry.content:
This option only works with UseFakeDeviceForMediaStream which thus

only works with MediaStreams. There are non-MediaStream input

streams created that could benefit from this option.



Make the existing --disable-audio-input flag from Fuchsia work on

all platforms, so UseFileForFakeAudioCapture can be used everywhere.



R=tguilbert

entry.title: Add metrics that counts up speculation rules prerenders per page
entry.content:
This CL introduces the metric that records the number of eventually received speculation rules prerender triggers per primary page changed,

classified with their eagerness.



This aims to investigate the overall latest usage amount of speculation

rules prerenders that developers actually try to use in one page, as

well as their difference on each eagerness. This is expected to be an

insight to improve prerender limits and schedulers.

entry.title: Fix printing browser tests for StartBasicPrintCancel
entry.content:
Rework the out-of-process callback handling for TestPrinterQueryOop so

that platforms which don't support OOP system print dialogs will use the

same callbacks as the in-browser tests that use TestPrinterQuery. This

ensures that there are now callbacks in all cases when getting default

settings and when asking the user for settings. This affects the

expectations of multiple tests which involve basic printing.



Replace the separate tests for StartBasicPrintCancel with a single test

that covers the same permutations.



This allows testing of StartBasicPrintCancel to be enabled again,

without any dependency on the system dialog being out-of-process.



Bug: 1375007, 1414968

entry.title: [Promise Icons] Add progress/ status fields to Launcher/ Shelf metadata
entry.content:
Remove progress/ status fields from AppServicePromiseAppItem, and add

equivalent fields to ChromeAppListItem metadata. This involves adding

more values to the AppStatus enum to indicate promise status. Moving

these fields into the ChromeAppListItem/ metadata level allows the

AppListModel and the updater to more easily access them and apply the

promise app effects.



For both Launcher and Shelf, the AppStatus value informs what icon

effects to apply to the icon, and the progress value will inform how

to draw the progress bar overlay of the promise app item.



Bug: b/261907495

entry.title: [floss] Fix emulator doesn't show Bluetooth tile
entry.content:
This CL sets the default adapter as enabled on FakeFlossManagerClient

is constructed, so that the default adapter IsPresent to Chrome.



Since the adapter is present to Chrome, browser_tests become truly

using the BT functionality and some bugs are caught:

- collision_detection_utils.cc: Missing null pointer check

- fake_floss_adapter_client.h/cc: Missing mock implementations

- floss_adapter_client.h: CreateBluetoothDeviceFloss returns the

VendorProductInfo having leftover value



Also, the hard-coded connected device (kBondedAddress1) generates

toast on UI started, which is affecting several browser tests.

This patch makes no connected device by default, and adds a flag for

the device tests that require connected device.



BUG=b:274815204

TEST=./out/Default/chrome --enable-features=Floss

entry.title: Allow preloads to boost the priority of in-flight requests.
entry.content:
This fixes a long-standing TODO where "preload" requests were not able

to increase the priority of a matching in-flight request. This includes

both as well as resources discovered by the

preload scanner.



Historically it wouldn't have been that much of an issue since

resources of a given type would always have the same priority but that

changed with support for "fetchpriority" where, for example, images

later in a document can be tagged as a higher priority than the same

resource earlier in the document.



Bug: 1467226

entry.title: Initializing AAC encoder with VBR mode on Windows when requested.
entry.content:
VBR for AAC might not be supported on different Windows versions(win10-). When platform reports not supporting it, fallback silently to CBR mode, since spec intends to set VBR mode by default and we prefer not failing audio encoder configuration at the default bitrate mode.

entry.title: Files app: DriveFS ignore --disable-sync flag
entry.content:
In CL:1286015 it was introduced to disable Google Drive when

--disable-sync flag was present. However we want to use this flag in

the Tast tests to stop the interference of syncing prefs across

tests/devices.



The tests in the Chromium repository don't seem to rely on this flag

anymore as was stated in the original CL.



Change the DriveIntegrationService and DriveFsHost to not depend on

the DriveNotificationManager, since this has been replaced to be done

via other ways.



Drive reflects automatically in a open Files app window.

entry.title: [Extension bindings] Add lastError accessor into APIBindingJsUtil
entry.content:
This CL adds an accessor function into the binidings JS util that lets

JS custom bindings get at the lastError message in a private way through

a new function. This is to allow custom binidings to do custom error

handling when calling into internal APIs safely, avoiding cases where

lastError may have been overridden by a script.
